Mr, Marvin D. Miller
- 3 -
October 2, 1956
Four times a year, on a quarterly basis, member stations subscribing to the
Network service are sent an “offering1* showing what programs will be offered
by the Network during the ensuing 13 weeks, (I am enclosing a copy of the
latest offering’for your information,) The stations then indicate which pro¬
grams series they wish to receive. This order form is returned to Headquarters
and tapes are shipped weekly, two or three weeks in advance of broadcast dates.
After the stations have used the programs, they may either return the tapes to
us, or if they want to keep certain programs in their files, they may return
any good tapes and get credit. We keep records of all tapes shipped to stations
and those returned and can tell at all times how many tapes a given station owes
us.
I*m afraid that I don*t know quite what you have in mind when you ask for “in¬
formation or sources of information concerning educational radio," since this
is such a large field. It*s probable that we could answer any specific ques¬
tions that you might have.
The address you requested is: Lang-Worth Feature Programs, Inc., 113 West 57th
Street, New York 19, New York.
I trust that this will give you the information you need and if you have any
further questions, please let me know.
Sincerely,
Harold E. Hill
Associate Director
